India Champions Trophy squad announcement: Experts spark Rahul vs Pant debate; Selectors to decide fate on Jan 11 - Hindustan Times
summary:
India Champions Trophy Squad Announcement: Experts Spark Rahul vs Pant Debate; Selectors to Decide Fate on Jan 11

Publication Date: January 9, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

The Indian cricket team's selection for the upcoming Champions Trophy is generating discussions among experts, especially concerning the inclusion of KL Rahul and Rishabh Pant as wicketkeepers. The Ajit Agarkar-led selection committee is expected to announce the 15-member squad on January 11, with significant decisions ahead for the team following a poor Test series performance.

  • The Champions Trophy starts on February 19 in Pakistan, but India will play their matches in Dubai.
  • Selectors are debating between retaining Rohit Sharma as captain and choosing a vice-captain from Shubman Gill and Jasprit Bumrah.
  • Three senior players—KL Rahul, Mohammed Shami, and Ravindra Jadeja—are reportedly at risk of being excluded from the squad.
  • Finally, there is significant anticipation regarding Pant's potential exclusion in light of recent performances.
“Pant was away from cricket for a long time...KL Rahul should be your first-choice keeper,” said cricket expert Sanjay Manjrekar.

In conclusion, the final squad announcement is highly anticipated, with critical considerations impacting the team's dynamics as they prepare for the Champions Trophy.
newTitle: India Champions Trophy Squad Announcement Sparks Debate Over Rahul vs Pant

title: "Virat Kohli Wanted Conflict And Confrontation": Ex-RCB Teammate Blasts India Stalwart - NDTV Sports
summary:

Publication Date: January 25, 2025

Source: NDTV Sports

Virat Kohli's recent tour in Australia ended on a controversial note, raising questions about his mindset during the matches. Kohli faced criticism from former teammates for his on-field behavior.

  • Kohli started the series strong with a century but finished with poor performance.
  • He was fined 20% of his match fees after a clash with Australia's Sam Konstas.
  • Simon Katich expressed concerns over Kohli's reputation due to multiple incidents during the tour.
  • Aaron Finch noted that Kohli seemed to be seeking conflict to spark his performance.
  • Kohli struggled with scoring, amassing only 190 runs across nine innings.
“There’s no doubt he has been a modern great of the game ... but I think he’s tarnished his reputation somewhat on this tour.” - Simon Katich

Overall, Kohli's performance raised more questions than answers, indicating a need for reflection moving forward.

title: South Africa’s sports minister joins growing calls for boycott of Afghanistan - The Guardian
summary:
South Africa's Sports Minister Supports Boycott of Afghanistan in Champions Trophy

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

South Africa’s sports minister, Gayton McKenzie, has joined increasing calls to boycott the upcoming match against Afghanistan in the Champions Trophy, emphasizing the need for cricket to uphold women’s rights in light of the Taliban’s policies.

  • McKenzie urges Cricket South Africa to reconsider participating in the match scheduled for February 21.
  • The call follows pressures from British politicians urging England not to play against Afghanistan.
  • McKenzie highlights the hypocrisy of ignoring women's rights, comparing it to past apartheid injustices.
  • More than 160 British politicians have signed a letter advocating for England's boycott of the match on February 26.
  • Cricket Australia postponed a bilateral series against Afghanistan last March due to human rights concerns but previously faced accusations of hypocrisy for playing them in other tournaments.
“As a man who comes from a race that was not allowed equal access to sporting opportunities during apartheid, it would be hypocritical and immoral to look the other way today when the same is being done towards women anywhere in the world.” - Gayton McKenzie

The situation underscores a broader discussion on the role of sports in promoting social justice and the influence of political acts on international sporting events.
newTitle: South Africa's Sports Minister Supports Boycott of Afghanistan in Champions Trophy

title: Sunil Gavaskar Predicts India's Next Captain After Rohit Sharma: 'He Leads From The Front' - News18
summary:
Sunil Gavaskar Predicts India's Next Captain After Rohit Sharma: 'He Leads From The Front'

Date: January 09, 2025

Source: News

Legendary former cricketer Sunil Gavaskar believes Jasprit Bumrah is the frontrunner to become India’s next captain, potentially taking over from Rohit Sharma soon. Gavaskar praised Bumrah’s leadership qualities and his ability to support his teammates without applying pressure.

  • Bumrah has led India in two Tests during the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.
  • Gavaskar noted Bumrah’s visible leadership and guidance on the field.
  • Bumrah's leadership is under consideration due to Rohit Sharma’s inconsistent performance and personal absence.
  • The BCCI will hold a review meeting to discuss the future of leadership in the team.
  • There are concerns about Bumrah's workload as he is now the only all-format player for India.
“He leads from the front. He has got a very good air about him. The air of a leader,” - Sunil Gavaskar

The potential change in captaincy highlights the evolving leadership dynamics within the Indian cricket team, particularly in light of recent performances.
newTitle: Sunil Gavaskar Predicts India's Next Captain After Rohit Sharma

title: Rajasthan overcome TN, Haryana beat Bengal in VH pre-quarters - Cricbuzz
summary:
Rajasthan overcome TN, Haryana beat Bengal in VH pre-quarters

Published on: Thu, Jan 9, 2025, 01:51 PM Source: Cricbuzz

Rajasthan triumphed over Tamil Nadu in a thrilling pre-quarterfinal match of the Vijay Hazare Trophy, securing a place in the quarterfinals. Haryana also claimed victory against Bengal, thanks to a strong all-round performance.

  • Rajasthan beat Tamil Nadu by 19 runs, scoring 267 and restricting TN to 248.
  • Abhijeet Tomar scored a century (111) for Rajasthan.
  • Varun Chakravarthy claimed five wickets for Tamil Nadu but it wasn’t enough.
  • Haryana defeated Bengal by 72 runs, posting 298 runs in their innings.
  • Parth Vats contributed significantly with both bat (62) and ball (3-33).
“Rajasthan emerged victorious in their pre-quarterfinal clash against Tamil Nadu, an exciting contest where the momentum kept shifting.”

Both teams have showcased their ability to perform under pressure, setting the stage for exciting quarterfinal matches ahead.
newTitle: Rajasthan and Haryana Advance in Vijay Hazare Trophy Pre-Quarters

title: Novak Djokovic Conquered Tennis. What’s Next? - GQ
summary:
Novak Djokovic Conquered Tennis. What’s Next?

Publication Date: Not specified Source: GQ

In a reflective moment in Montenegro, tennis legend Novak Djokovic, now 37, contemplates his extraordinary career while facing the pressures of impending retirement. His recent Olympic gold medal signifies a major achievement, yet Djokovic seems eager to continue competing, contemplating both the how and when of his potential retirement.

  • Djokovic discusses his meticulous nature, especially regarding food during tournaments.
  • He shares insights into his life beyond tennis, his relationship with family, and the emotional challenges of being away from them.
  • While reflecting on his career, Djokovic acknowledges his successes but also considers the ongoing pressures he faces.
  • He addresses his controversial deportation from Australia and the misconceptions surrounding it, emphasizing his stance on personal choice regarding health.
  • Finally, Djokovic expresses a desire to focus on cultural similarities in the Balkans rather than past divisions, highlighting his pacifistic approach.
“Both publicly and privately, a lot of people told me they think it’s best if you leave on a high… but if I still physically am capable, why would I want to stop now?”

As Djokovic prepares for a potential return to the Australian Open, he reflects on his remarkable journey and considers what lies ahead, balancing personal ambitions with familial responsibilities.
newTitle: Novak Djokovic Conquered Tennis. What’s Next?

The Indian cricket team recently faced rumors of a dressing room rift during the Border Gavaskar Trophy series against Australia. Coach Gautam Gambhir and captain Rohit Sharma aimed to quell the speculations, asserting that their focus should not be on external noise.

In a passionate defense, former cricketer Navjot Singh Sidhu criticized the harsh treatment towards Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma amidst their recent poor performance in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy, urging fans to show respect and patience.

  • Kohli scored only 190 runs in five Tests, while Rohit missed the last Test due to form issues.
  • Sidhu referenced the historical allowances given to past players for their slumps.
  • He emphasized the importance of supporting Kohli and Sharma as they prepare for upcoming ODI matches.

title: 'Virat Kohli should have been banned for what he did to Sam Konstas' - The Times of India
summary:
Virat Kohli should have been banned for what he did to Sam Konstas

Publication Date: Not provided Source: Times of India

Former England pacer Steve Harmison condemns Virat Kohli’s behavior during a recent match against debutant Sam Konstas, suggesting that Kohli should have received a ban for his actions.

  • Kohli received a demerit point and a 20% fine for physical contact with Konstas during the Boxing-Day Test.
  • The incident escalated with Kohli and Konstas exchanging intense glares before umpires intervened.
  • Harmison warns Konstas about the challenges he will face in the upcoming Ashes series.
  • Harmison emphasized the need for Konstas to focus on his defensive technique instead of mimicking aggressive players like David Warner.
“What happened with Kohli there – Kohli was bang out of order. Virat Kohli should have been banned for what he did.” - Steve Harmison

The incident has raised questions about player conduct in high-pressure situations and the implications for both Kohli and Konstas as they navigate their respective careers in cricket.
newTitle: Criticism of Virat Kohli's On-Field Conduct Amidst Ongoing Season

title: ‘Gautam Gambhir is a hypocrite’: Manoj Tiwary blasts India head coach after BGT failure - The Indian Express
summary:

Date: January 9, 2025

Former India batter Manoj Tiwary criticized India coach Gautam Gambhir after a disappointing Border Gavaskar Trophy, labeling him a ‘hypocrite’ for not practicing what he preaches.

  • Tiwary accused Gambhir of favoritism and questioned why certain players from Mumbai received preferential treatment.
  • He noted that Gambhir's captaincy during the Kolkata Knight Riders' 2012 IPL win was a collective team effort, not just due to Gambhir’s leadership.
  • Gambhir is under scrutiny after India’s BGT loss to Australia, marking a failure after a decade.
“Gautam Gambhir doesn’t do what he says... But who took the credit? There is an environment and PR that allows him to take all the credit.” - Manoj Tiwary

Gambhir faces mounting pressure as India not only lost the BGT but also suffered a series of defeats across formats leading up to this event.
newTitle: Manoj Tiwary Criticizes Gautam Gambhir's Coaching After Recent Cricket Setback
